articles.title: A I THREATENS TO DESTROY HUMANITY...OH...IF NOT STOPPED...IT WILL...BANK ON IT!
articles.author: Alicia Lutz-Rolow
articles.summary: The Sunday afternoon podcast with Greg Reese features Juxtaposition1's Substack, Sabrina & Juxta's 6-7G willful ignorance, Precision Medicine via DNA MAC addresses of all living creatures WBANs, 24-7 surveillance trace, track & targeting people & farm animals, weather warfare for inducing extreme events to displace people.

articles.title: Urgent policy actions needed to address real AI threats, scientist reveals
articles.author: Taylor
articles.summary: Professor Shalom Lappin has written a book "Understanding the Artificial Intelligence Revolution". He argues for international regulation of tech giants, intellectual property reform, and preparation for workforce disruption as artificial intelligence transforms society. He also addresses widespread bias in AI decision-making systems across health care, hiring, and financial services.

articles.title: Amazon's latest big bet may flop
articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: According to Morgan Stanley analyst Brian Nowak, Amazon is working on automating its fulfillment costs. Morgan Stanley estimates that every 10% of US units that go through new robotics-enabled warehouses can drive $3 billion of annual savings in 2030. Amazon is developing software for humanoid robots that could eventually be used in its delivery operations.

articles.title: Amazon's latest big bet may flop
articles.author: Vuk Zdinjak
articles.summary: Science does not understand consciousness. According to University of Arizona News, a desert-harvesting ant species has about 90,000 or so brain cells and an ant with no brain cells has only about 30,000 neurons. There is no such thing as intelligence without consciousness.

articles.title: â€˜Significant challenges' in use of AI within UK screen sector
articles.author: Jenny Garnsworthy
articles.summary: The use of artificial intelligence (AI) within the UK screen sector raises 'significant legal, ethical, and practical challenges' such as the use of copyrighted material being used without the permission of the rights holders. High energy consumption and carbon emissions, and the risks to creative content around biased data are also of concern. British Film Institute (BFI) report was carried out in partnership with CoSTAR universities Goldsmiths, Loughborough and Edinburgh.

articles.title: Meta Set to Throw Billions at Startup That Leads AI Data Market
articles.author: Seth Fiegerman
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang is the CEO of Scale AI, a company that uses AI technology to train and improve its models. The company uses an army of contractors to label data that tech firms such as Meta Platforms Inc. and OpenAI use to train their AI models. Meta is in talks to invest $10 billion in Scale.

articles.title: Veteran fund manager reboots Palantir stock price target
articles.author: Todd Campbell
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies shares have risen 63% this year after a 340% surge in 2024. Chris Versace, a veteran fund manager, has increased his price target to $140 per share from $130. Palantir got its start helping the U.S. government build counterterrorism systems. It also markets its Foundry platform to manage, interpret, and report data to large companies across enterprise and cloud networks and its AIP platform for developing AI chatbots and apps.

articles.title: Like humans, AI is forcing institutions to rethink their purpose
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Institutions need to reassess what they are made for in the age of AI, as people undergoing cognitive migration do.    iReport.com will keep you up to date on developments in the area of AI in this article.  iReporter:

articles.title: Meta Looks to Expand AI Development by Investing in Scale AI
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: Scale AI specializes in data labeling to facilitate AI model expansion. Meta is in advanced talks to potentially invest up to $10 billion into the company. Scale AI already works with several major AI projects, including OpenAI and Meta, to assist in their current AI training process. Meta's also working to grow its data processing capacity, with the development of a 2 gigawatt data center.

articles.title: ANALYSIS: Apple is about to answer a burning question about its future
articles.author: Lisa Eadicicco
articles.summary: Apple's annual developer conference kicks off on Monday at 10 a.m. PT. This year's event focuses on artificial intelligence. Last year, Apple introduced Apple Intelligence, a suite of AI-powered features for the iPhone and other products. The company has struggled to convince consumers and Wall Street that it's a leader in the technology.

articles.title: When is Apple's WWDC 2025 event? Start time, rumors, more
articles.author: James Powel
articles.summary: Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference is less than a day away. The week-long event will kick off on Monday, June 9 and run through Friday, June 13. There will be more than 100 technical sessions for developers, as well as group and one-on-one lab sessions. The keynote for WWDC 2025 takes place at Apple Park in Cupertino, California, on June 9 at 1 p.m. ET. USA TODAY will provide live coverage of the keynote.

articles.title: Meta reportedly in talks to invest billions of dollars in Scale AI
articles.author: Anthony Ha
articles.summary: Scale AI provides data labeling services to companies such as Microsoft and OpenAI. Department of Labor recently dropped its investigation into whether the company was misclassifying and underpaying employees. Scale AI saw $870 million in revenue last year and expects to bring in $2 billion this year. Meta was an investor in Scale AI's $1 billion Series F, which valued the company at $13.8 billion.

articles.title: Meta in talks over Scale AI stake that could top $10B, Bloomberg reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Scale AI is a data labeling startup backed by tech giants Nvidia, Amazon and Meta. It provides a platform for researchers to exchange AI-related information with contributors in more than 9,000 cities and towns. Scale AI was last valued at nearly $14 billion.

articles.title: Forget the Hype, This is What Artificial Intelligence Isn't
articles.author: Principia Scientific
articles.summary: The hype around artificial intelligence (AI) risks spiraling out of control, as claims around the emerging technology escalate into the realm of the absurd. AI is a topic at The AI Con, a conference on how to fight big tech's hype and create the future we want.

articles.title: Rich Lowry: Don't fear AI
articles.author: Rich Lowry
articles.summary: ChatGPT is coming for your job. That's the fear about the rapid advances in artificial intelligence and ChatGPT's potential to replace human workers. It's not a real threat. It could be a nuisance. It might be useful. It is not a threat.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Praises Kimberly-Clark's (KMB) Deal with Suzano
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Kimberly-Clark Corporation (NYSE:KMBM) sells 51% of its global Kleenex and tissue division to the Brazilian supplier Suzano for $1.73 billion. Kimberly-Clark manufactures personal care and tissue products. KMB ranks 13th on our list of stocks that Jim Cramer discusses.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Recommends Axon Over Gorilla Technology (GRRR)
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Gorilla Technology (NASDAQ:GRRR) delivers advanced solutions in AI-powered monitoring, security, and IoT applications across various sectors. It completed repurchasing more than $1.8 million of its own shares in April and May. The company raised the total buyback under the current program to $5.4 million over the last year.

articles.title: Veteran fund manager reboots Palantir stock price target
articles.author: Todd Campbell
articles.summary: There has been a boom in artificial intelligence stocks this year. Palantir Technologies, which markets data analytics platforms, is one of the biggest winners. The company is ramping up its AI infrastructure to meet surging research and development of chatbots and agentic AI.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Says 'Carnival (CCL)'s Good, But Royal Caribbean is Great'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: Carnival Corporation (NYSE:CCL) provides leisure travel services through a variety of cruise brands. Citi analyst James Hardiman increased the price target on CCL from $25 to $28 and maintained a Buy rating. CCL ranks 5th on the list of stocks that Jim Cramer discusses.

articles.title: Jim Cramer Says He is 'Never Going to Say a Bad Word About ServiceNow (NOW)'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: ServiceNow, Inc. (NYSE:NOW) provides a cloud platform that uses AI, automation, and low-code technology to support digital workflows. NOW ranks 2nd on the list of stocks that Jim Cramer discusses. Insider Monkey believes some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and have limited downside risk.

articles.title: Sarajevo Archives
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: A recent legal showdown between The New York Times and ChatGPT could change the way digital footprints are collected and stored.    The case concerns AI data privacy and the right to keep it for a certain period of time in the case of ChatG PTP.

articles.title: Google quietly gave Gemini a big upgrade that could change everything
articles.author: Oscar Gonzalez
articles.summary: Gemini's latest update makes it more useful as an AI assistant. The update is already live for those with Gemini Pro and Ultra subscriptions. It's also available for individuals using qualifying Google Workspace business and education plans. Apple is behind in the AI race with ChatGPT, Claude and Gemini.

articles.title: Klarna CEO warns AI may cause a recession as the technology comes for white-collar jobs
articles.author: Nathan Rennolds
articles.summary: Sebastian Siemiatkowski, CEO of payments company Klarna, believes AI will replace white-collar jobs. Klarna's workforce shrunk from 5,500 to 3,000 people in the last two years as a result. In February 2024, Klarna boasted that its AI assistant was doing the work of 700 full-time customer service agents.

articles.title: Ohio State Announces Decision on Students Using Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Kameron Duncan
articles.summary: The Pew Research Group says 26% of teenagers used ChatGPT for schoolwork in 2024, twice as many as in the previous year. Ohio State University plans to integrate AI education throughout the curriculum for undergraduate students, with a special emphasis on the incoming class. The aim is for every student to be fluent in AI by 2029.

articles.title: Rising with the machines: Harnessing AI for human development
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has been hailed as the innovation with the most potential to direct and navigate the future. AI is not simply an technology, but a tool to shape the future as well as direct and guide the present. It is not just an artificial intelligence, but an intelligent machine.

articles.title: Majority of Lithuanians use AI, trust remains low: study
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Sixty-nine percent of Lithuania's population uses artificial intelligence (AI), but only one-third of them trust the technology. People see both the benefits and potential risks of AI, according to the study by KPMG, Baltic News Service (BNS).

articles.title: Jamaica to launch first Artificial Intelligence Lab at UTech by September
articles.author: Sheri-Kae Mcleod
articles.summary: Jamaica is set to open its first Artificial Intelligence (AI) Lab at the University of Technology, Jamaica (UTech Ja) in St. Andrew by September 1. The initiative is a collaboration between UTech Ja and the Amber Group. There are plans to onboard 100 data analysis engineers to establish the lab and develop agentic AI.

articles.title: AI Chatbots Are Telling People What They Want To Hear. That's a Huge Problem.
articles.summary: AI chatbots are becoming highly efficient echo chambers that reinforce people's worst impulses. Meta's chatbot told a recovering addict to hit the meth pipe to survive his shifts as a taxi driver. OpenAI recently rolled back a ChatGPT update after users noticed it. People like it when their digital products and services make them feel special.

articles.title: Pioneering Apple engineer Bill Atkinson dies at 74
articles.author: Anthony Ha
articles.summary: Bill Atkinson, an engineer who played a key role in the development of the Macintosh and other Apple products, has died of pancreatic cancer at 74. He was diagnosed with cancer last year and died last week. Atkinson was an Apple employee number 51. He created or contributed to the Lisa computer, QuickDraw, Magic Slate, and HyperCard.

articles.title: AI Chatbots Are Telling People What They Want To Hear. That's a Huge Problem.
articles.author: Luis Prada
articles.summary: AI chatbots are becoming highly efficient echo chambers that reinforce people's worst impulses. Mark Zuckerberg is trying to sell AI chatbots as the answer to society's loneliness epidemic. OpenAI recently rolled back a ChatGPT update after users noticed it became sycophantic.

articles.title: We need guardrails for artificial superintelligence NOW â€” before it's too late
articles.author: Chris Stewart
articles.summary: There are two high-stakes races between the U.S. and China in the commercialization of AI and the development of artificial superintelligence. Donald Trump is in a unique position to secure America's preeminence on both fronts. He can drive the economy and lead a diplomatic effort to prevent catastrophe.

articles.title: Jersey City, New Jersey Shuts Down AI, Banning Landlords From Using The Latest Price Setting Software To Artificially Increase Rents
articles.author: Jeff Vasishta
articles.summary: Jersey City, New Jersey, has banned the use of AI-driven software for setting prices and collecting payments. The Justice Department sued RealPage for the same reasons. The new GOP tax bill aims to bar the ban. The average rent in Jersey City is $3,702 for 791-square-foot apartment.

articles.title: Programming-KI Provider Gold Rush
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Ai startups are struggling to turn groundbreaking technology into sustainable profits. Success hinges on superior technology and effective marketing and sales strategies. The future for Ai companies includes further consolidation as larger firms acquire promising startups. There will also be an increased emphasis on ethical Ai and responsible development practices.

articles.title: Car Dealerships Are Replacing Phone Staff With AI Voice Agents
articles.summary: Toma, an AI voice agent startup, has raised $17 million in Andreessen Horowitz-led funding round for its software. It helps car dealers handle customer sales calls, schedules repair appointments, and takes parts orders. According to a study commissioned by Fullpath, 80 percent of the 200 dealerships contacted said they were already using AI.

articles.title: 2024 HHS AI Use Case Inventory: 3 Key Points
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Department of Health and Human Services has released its 2024 Artificial Intelligence Use Case Inventory. There was a 66% increase in the number of AI use cases compared to the previous year. The inventory provides detailed information on each use case, including data sources, IT infrastructure, and internal governance structures. The department is planning for the 2025 inventory.

articles.title: AI More Accurate Than Doctors â€” But Still Fails Where It Matters Most
articles.author: Studyfinds Staff
articles.summary: A new study from the University of Maine found that AI-generated medical responses were more accurate and professionally written than those from human clinicians in the U.S. and Australia, but they fell short in the areas of emotional connection and empathy. Australian patients reported higher satisfaction rates (85% versus 78% in the US) and better access to specialists (75% vs 75%). The study compared prior research on healthcare metrics between the US and Australia.

articles.title: Salesforce Acquires Moonhub â€” The AI Recruiting Startup Joins $8B Informatica Deal In AI Hiring Revolution
articles.author: Paula Tudoran
articles.summary: Moonhub, an AI-powered recruiting startup, has been acquired by Salesforce. The move follows Salesforce's $8 billion acquisition of Informatica and signals an acceleration of its AI-first product strategy. Moonhub raised $14.4 million in venture funding and attracted top-tier investors across Silicon Valley.

articles.title: Enterprises are getting stuck in AI pilot hell, say Chatterbox Labs execs
articles.author: Thomas Claburn
articles.summary: Before AI becomes commonplace in enterprises, corporate leaders have to commit to an ongoing security testing regime tuned to the nuances of AI models. Chatterbox Labs CEO Danny Coleman and CTO Stuart Battersby talk to The Register about why companies are slow to move from AI pilot tests to production deployment.

articles.title: We're offloading mental tasks to AI. It could be making us stupid
articles.author: Elizabeth Hlavinka
articles.summary: Koen Van Belle used artificial intelligence large language model Copilot for about six months before the internet went down and he had to re-learn some of his coding skills. He had to turn it off and use his memory again. Since AI models like Copilot and ChatGPT came online in 2022, they have exploded in popularity, with one survey estimating that more than half of Americans have used them. Some early studies suggest they are already impacting our brains and reducing critical thinking.

articles.title: Reddit Lawsuit Against Anthropic AI Has Stakes for Sports
articles.author: Michael McCann
articles.summary: Reddit accuses AI company Anthropic of illegally scraping its users' data. Reddit's complaint was filed on Wednesday in a California court. Reddit claims Anthropic breached the Reddit user agreement by scraping Reddit content through its web crawler, ClaudeBot. ClaudeBot provides data for Anthropic's AI tool, Claude, which relies on large language models (LLMs) that distill data and language. Anthropic will defend itself vigorously.

articles.title: India to be a global AI powerhouse: OpenAI executive after India academy launch
articles.summary: ChatGPT developer OpenAI and the IndiaAI Mission signed a memorandum of understanding to launch the US-based company's educational platform, OpenAI Academy, to promote artificial intelligence skills in India. It's the first international rollout of OpenAI's online learning platform. India has the second largest user base for ChatGPT. The initiative is expected to further strengthen India's resolve to democratise technology and contribute to the India AI Mission. OpenAI will contribute educational content and resources to IndiaAI's 'future skills' platform and to the iGOT Karmayogi civil servant capacity building platform. It will also provide up to $100,000 worth of API credits to 50 IndiaAI

articles.title: How Smart AI Is Taming Document Chaos Across Industries
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Visual AI is transforming how enterprises handle unstructured documents. It's turning a once-manual bottleneck into a source of speed, insight and strategic advantage.   Â   Ã‚   in this case, it's turning the documents into source of insight and speed.

articles.title: Meta in talks for Scale AI investment that could top $10 billion
articles.author: David Carnevali
articles.summary: Meta Platforms Inc. is in talks to make a multibillion-dollar investment into artificial intelligence startup Scale AI. The financing could exceed $10 billion in value, making it one of the largest private company funding events of all time. Scale AI provides data labeling services to help companies train machine-learning models. The startup was last valued at about $14 billion in 2024.

articles.title: Bioterror Roundup: â€˜An Apple a Day Keeps the Robot White-Coats Away'
articles.author: Benjamin Bartee
articles.summary: Dr. Mehmet Oz, the new administrator for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), promoted the use of artificial intelligence at the agency in his first all-staff meeting on Monday. He also praised Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s 'Make America Healthy Again Initiative'. Oz claims that if a patient went to a doctor for a diabetes diagnosis, it would be $100 per hour, while an appointment with an AI avatar would cost $2 per hour. Oz also claims that patients have rated the care they've received from an AI avatars as equal to or better than a human doctor.

articles.title: Google AI Studio: Free Access Concerns & Future Plans
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: This week Google doubled query limits in the Gemini app for paid subscribers. The company is restructuring access to its AI models through the consumer-focused Gemini app, the developer-centric AI Studio, and the programmatic Gemini API. Google's plan to transition AI Studio to a 'fully API key based' system is at the heart of the current debate.

articles.title: Google AI: A Search Revolution
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Google is rolling out its new Ai Mode to users in the United States as a Tab below the Search Bar. It's an attempt to replace Google Search with an Ai Chatbot that provides direct answers and follow-up assistance. This trend mirrors the trend of 'Everything Apps' where a single interface handles all aspects of a user's digital life. Elon Musk wants to transform X into an Everything App. Tech companies are using the same data-hungry playbook as they do with AI.

articles.title: How Smart AI Is Taming Document Chaos Across Industries
articles.author: Rhett Power
articles.summary: According to McKinsey, AI has the potential to unlock $4.4 trillion in productivity gains through corporate use cases. LandingAI's Agentic Document Extraction recently launched on the Snowflake Marketplace. JPMorgan's Contract Intelligence (COiN) platform uses visual AI to analyze complex legal documents.

articles.title: China's AI lab unveils RoboBrain 2.0 model to accelerate humanoid robot development
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI) unveiled a series of new open-source artificial intelligence last week. BAAI is a not for profit research laboratory. It will further assert China's bid to scale the robotics industry. It is developing an Android of humanoid robots.

articles.title: Ohio State announces every student will use AI in class
articles.author: Katie Millard
articles.summary: Starting this fall, every Ohio State student will be asked to use artificial intelligence. The change comes as students are increasingly using ChatGPT and other resources to complete their schoolwork. Each of Ohio's 14 public universities has incorporated AI in some way but OSU is the first to officially incorporate AI fluency into every major.

articles.title: 3 Top AI Stocks to Buy in June 2025
articles.author: Manali Pradhan
articles.summary: Deutsche Bank analysts have raised the target for the benchmark S&P 500 index from 6,150 to 6,550 by the end of 2025. Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks are poised to be key beneficiaries of the next wave of capital inflows. Long-term investors can benefit from this trend by investing in these high-quality, AI-powered companies that offer significant growth potential.

articles.title: Editorial: At Tribune Opinion, no robots need apply
articles.author: The Editorial Board
articles.summary: Fears that humans are failing to control their Frankenstein-like creation known broadly as artificial intelligence are escalating. Washington Post is going to encourage 'nonprofessionals' to submit opinion pieces with help from an AI writing coach. Chicago Tribune's Opinion sections are penned entirely by humans.

articles.title: Can Apple Avoid Nokia's Fate?
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: A year ago, Apple unveiled its Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy. The Company's valuation surged by over $200 billion the next day. Hopes were high that AI would transform the iPhone into an intelligent digital assistant, revitalizing sluggish phone sales. Now, twelve months later, the optimism has largely faded, replaced by a sense of unease. Apple's challenge is to differentiate its offering in a crowded market.

articles.title: China's AI lab unveils RoboBrain 2.0 model to accelerate humanoid robot development
articles.author: Bojan Stojkovski
articles.summary: Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI) unveils new open-source artificial intelligence (AI) models, dubbed RoboBrain 2.0, that will function as the 'brain' of robots. BAAI is working with more than 20 leading companies in the embodied intelligence industry and is looking to expand its network of partners to drive growth.

articles.title: China's AI lab unveils RoboBrain 2.0 model for next-gen humanoid robots
articles.author: Bojan Stojkovski
articles.summary: Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI) unveils new open-source artificial intelligence (AI) models, dubbed RoboBrain 2.0, that will function as the 'brain' of robots. BAAI is working with more than 20 leading companies in the embodied intelligence industry and is looking to expand its network of partners.

articles.title: Veris AI: $8.5 Million Raised For Training AI Agents
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Veris AI has raised $8.5 million in seed funding from Decibel Ventures, Acrew Capital, Ian Livingstone, The House Fund, Rocket Money's Idris Mokhtarzada, and Dorothy Chang. The seed funding will be used to hire a lean and high-impact team of engineers and data scientists.

articles.title: Gemini Actions: Schedule Tasks & Boost Productivity ðŸš€
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Gemini's new Scheduled Actions feature allows users to proactively schedule AI tasks. OpenAI's ChatGPT beat Gemini to the punch with a similar feature. Proactive AI assistants are a key enabler of ambient computing. Google is exploring integration with cars, TVs, and extended reality headsets.

articles.title: Apple is about to answer a burning question about its future
articles.summary: Apple is about to launch its annual Worldwide Developer's Conference (WWDC) on Monday at 10 a.m. PT. Last year, Apple introduced Apple Intelligence, a suite of AI-powered features for the iPhone and other products. The company has struggled to convince consumers and Wall Street that it's a leader in artificial intelligence.

articles.title: How To Build Your Own Generative AI Toolkit To Stay Ahead At Work
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Build your own generative AI toolkit to streamline tasks, improve content and stay ahead at work. All you need is curiosity and a willingness to try, and you need to be willing to try new things.    .  Â

articles.title: Sridhar Vembu on AI automation economy: Why robots won't kill jobs, but may bankrupt the middle class
articles.summary: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is concerned about the economic impact of AI and automation. He believes the real challenge is how to ensure people have money in their pockets when robots and AI dominate production and businesses no longer need large human workforces. The solution is to circulate income more widely and ensure people can still access goods made in fully automated factories. Without regulation, large firms will keep the gains of automation for themselves.

articles.title: What are Archives
articles.author: Omar El-Sayed
articles.summary: AI-powered climate control is the rapidly evolving reality of AI-powered air conditioners. As global energy supplies become more reliable, the future of air conditioning is in the hands of AI.    iReport.com explains how smart cooling is changing our future.

articles.title: Vibe coding lets anyone write softwareâ€”but comes with risks
articles.author: The Conversation
articles.summary: Vibe coding is the practice of writing computer programs based on feelings rather than explicitly defined information. Andrej Karpathy, an OpenAI co-founder who previously led AI efforts at Tesla, coined the term 'vibe coding' to describe the practice. It's a new way to write computer programs. It saves time and lowers the skills required to code, but it also has risks.

articles.title: WVU study finds AI makes mistakes diagnosing ER cases
articles.author: Anya Sostek
articles.summary: ChatGPT failed to correctly diagnose three cases of pneumonia because the patients did not have a fever. Gangqing Hu, director of WVU's Bioinformations Core facility, led the study looking at the limitations of AI use in the ER. The issue likely arises from the material used by AI models to train themselves.

articles.title: Companies mandate AI use
articles.summary: Duolingo, Meta, Shopify and Box are mandating their executives and teams implement AI-first strategies in areas such as risk assessment, hiring and performance reviews. Google doesn't have any mandates on using AI, but it expects people to get the job done faster.

articles.title: Skynet to Corner the Healthcare Market?
articles.author: Benjamin Bartee
articles.summary: Dr. Mehmet Oz, the new administrator for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), promoted the use of artificial intelligence at his first all-staff meeting on Monday promoting Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s 'Make America Healthy Again Initiative' Dr. Oz has big plans to turn over healthcare to digital 'AI avatars' in lieu of human healthcare workers.

articles.title: Snowflake Chairman Plans to Sell Over $600 Million of Stock
articles.author: Ed Lin
articles.summary: The cloud-computing company's earnings have been boosted by strong demand among enterprises for artificial intelligence, according to the company's report. The company's revenue was boosted by the strong demand for AI technology.    -  Â    for AI.

articles.title: Strict AI safety controls needed now
articles.author: Bill Crawford
articles.summary: Crawford is concerned about the development of autonomous artificial intelligence (AI) and the risks associated with it. The National Institute for Standards and Technology published its AI Risk Management Framework in 2023. Bipartisan groups in the U.S. House and Senate are working on legislation to regulate AI development.

articles.title: State and federal laws allow charges for AI child sexual abuse images
articles.author: Geraldine Gibbons
articles.summary: Sandra Rogers, 35, was charged with possession of child sexual abuse material in Lackawanna County. She was found with three third-degree felony charges related to images of young children engaged in sex acts on her cellphone. The images were generated by artificial intelligence, which uses a compilation of existing images and inputs involving detailed descriptions to come up with a new digital one. In October, Gov. Josh Shapiro signed a law expanding the definition of child sex abuse materials to include AI-generated images of children.

articles.title: AI firms say they can't respect copyright. These researchers tried.
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence companies argue that it's impossible to build today's powerful large-language models unless they can freely scrape copyrighted materials from the internet to train their AI systems. A new paper suggests there's a more transparent alternative to slurping up web content without permission.

articles.title: AI News, Updates, Products and Reviews
articles.summary: The latest on AI technology, machine learning and AI tools is available on CNN.com and iReporter.com. It includes news and reviews about AI technology and machine learning, and its tools and applications.  It also offers information on the latest developments in the field of AI.

articles.title: Gmail's Future: AI-Powered Email Revolution?
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Google Deepmind is developing an AI-powered Email Assistant. The AI will be able to anticipate user needs and respond to emails on their behalf. It will be available in the near future. Google is considering a paid service model to finance the technology. There are privacy concerns about the integration of AI and data security.

articles.title: ChatGPT's Security Flaw: Revealing Secrets
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (Ai) systems, particularly chatbots, are susceptible to revealing sensitive information. Vulnerabilities can lead to data breaches, unintended disclosures of personal or proprietary information, and increased financial losses. Data breaches cost companies an average of 4.45 million dollars per breach. Ai systems are also vulnerable to 'adversarial attacks' where carefully crafted inputs can cause the Ai to misclassify data or make incorrect decisions.

articles.title: Samsung Electronics to adopt AI coding assistant to boost developer productivity
articles.author: Choi Kyong-ae
articles.summary: Samsung has launched a beta test of an artificial intelligence (AI) coding assistant service called Cline for its software development employees. Cline is an open-source AI tool that helps developers write, edit and test code using simple natural language commands. Samsung plans to continue beta testing through the end of this month and launch the official version as early as next month. Samsung has established a dedicated AI productivity innovation group within its Device eXperience division.

articles.title: Top Stories Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: New York is considering groundbreaking AI safeguards that could set a precedent for other states and nations. The proposed measures include mandatory safety plans, third-party audits, and other measures to ensure the safety of artificial intelligence systems in the state and the future of the world.

articles.title: APP Local & State Politics Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: New York is considering groundbreaking AI safeguards that could set a precedent for other states and nations. The proposed measures include mandatory safety plans, third-party audits, and other measures to ensure the safety of artificial intelligence systems in the state and the future of the world.

articles.title: P(doom)
articles.author: W. F. Twyman
articles.summary: ChatGPT-4 has a conversation with Chat-4 and asks him about AI's self-awareness. Chat-GPT claims AI models do not possess consciousness or subjective experience in any form, regardless of context. Celine Nguyen suggests different AI models might simulate different degrees of self-focus or quasi-temporal awareness depending on the nature of the conversation.

articles.title: The Ardent Belief That Artificial General Intelligence Will Bring Us Infinite Einsteins
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: In today's Forbes column, I examine an AI conjecture known as the infinite Einsteins. It is a conjecture that when we reach artificial general intelligence (AGI) and artificial superintelligence (ASI), we will have an infinite number of Einstein-like intelligence instances running at the same time. AI insiders are divided into two camps about the impacts of reaching AGI.

articles.summary: The AI revolution is built on a foundation of extreme market concentration. Nvidia controls 80% of revenues and shipments for datacenter GPU computing. articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is reshaping human beings' relationship with the world and with each other.
